questions: Npm git reset --hard is used for what?
answer: To revert any changes and reset code back to the previous state prior to committing changes.

questions: What is the difference between npm and yarn?
answer: NPM installs dependency packages sequentially, Yarn installs in-parallel. Yarn allows for faster installation of larger files.

questions: What is the difference between npm and npx?
answer: Both Npm and Npx are tools. Npm is used install packages. Npx is used to execute packages.

questions: Npm i is used for what?
answer: To reinstall all current packages and dependencies.

questions: Git add . is used for what?
answer: To add all current files to the stage.

questions: Git status is used for what?
answer: To check the status of the of your working tree.

questions: Npm checkout -b is used for what?
answer: To create a new branch.

questions: Cd is used for what?
answer: To enter into the file, folder or section.

questions: Git touch is used for what
answer: To create a new and empty file/ folder.

questions: Git mkdir is used for what?
answer: To create a new directory.

questions: Git push is used for what?
answer: To push current committed changes to a repository.

questions: True or False: you can initialize a git repository straight from the terminal?
answer: True

questions: Git init is used for what?
answer: To initialize a git repository.

questions: True or False: git repositories can only be public?
answer: False

questions: True or False: it repositories can be shared with other collaborators on github?
answer: True

questions: True or False: only the creator of a github repository is capable of altering it?
answer: False. Anything shared with collaborators can be altered with pull requests.

questions: What is a pull request on github?
answer: It is a request sent from collaborators who have changed existing code within a code base.

questions: True or False: it is best practice to approve your own pull requests?
answer: False

questions: Git pull origin <branch> does what?
answer: It will pull in any new, and or updated code from the codebase to your local machine.

questions: Git checkout <branch> is used for what?
answer: To switch and or change branches.

questions: True or False: It is best practice to always work within the main branch?
answer: False, it is best to create a working branch, and merge from the working branch to the main branch once the code has been reviewed.

questions: Git merge is used for what?
answer: To merge code from one branch to another.

questions: Git ls command is used for what?
answer: To list / list the contents on your current directory.

questions: Git pwd is used for what?
answer: To print the current working directory.

questions: Git rmdir is used for what?
answer: To remove a directory, only on empty folders.

questions: Git clean is used for what?
answer: To remove untracked files in a directory.

questions: Git clear is used for what?
answer: To clear out the terminal, and allow it to display as a blank terminal.
